(2022 Review) Portal 2 was groundbreaking when it released in 2011 for its unique storytelling and gameplay. Now, 11 years later, it still holds up just as well. It hasn't aged perfectly -- there's LOTS of loading and plenty of less than HD textures -- but it's actually quite difficult to find any real flaws here. The game still looks great, the story and atmosphere remain compelling, and the gameplay is still unique and fantastic.

If you somehow haven't played Portal 2 by now, then you owe it to yourself to pick it up.

I loved this game when I played it on console and now that I've played it on PC I love it even more! It is such a beautifully designed game in every aspect, from the level and character design to the music. Absolutely phenomenal! This is definitely a must play game if you've never tried it, 10/10 game! Thank you Valve!

This game had me stuck a few times, but that is part of what makes this game so fun. You have to use what you've learned while playing through previous parts of the game. I would definitely play through Portal 1 first though as it takes place before Portal 2's story.
